paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on BRCA2 variants, including penetrance data and individual records.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: The index case in the FANCC c.67delG family developed breast cancer at age 60 but independent clinical testing subsequently identified a deleterious mutation in BRCA2 (c.8297delC, p.Thr2766Asnfs*11) in other breast cancer-affected family members.
The mutation is present in a male diagnosed with breast cancer but not in the youngest affected female relative in the family.
The mutation is present in a male diagnosed with breast cancer but not in the youngest affected female relative in the family.

functional_data.summary: The mutation is predicted to cause a frameshift leading to a truncated protein.

variants.segregation_data: The mutation co-segregated with breast cancer in the family.
variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence based on segregation and clinical presentation.
variants.additional_notes: The BRCA2 mutation was identified in a family previously classified as BRCA1/2 negative.
key_quotes: The index case in the FANCC c.67delG family developed breast cancer at age 60 but independent clinical testing subsequently identified a deleterious mutation in BRCA2 (c.8297delC, p.Thr2766Asnfs*11) in other breast cancer-affected family members.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: In family 6, exome sequencing identified a deleterious BRCA2 mutation (c.26delC, p.Pro9Glnfs*16) in a female diagnosed with breast cancer at age 30.
In family 6, exome sequencing identified a deleterious BRCA2 mutation (c.26delC, p.Pro9Glnfs*16) in a female diagnosed with breast cancer at age 30, but not in her cousin who was diagnosed at age 36.

functional_data.summary: The mutation is predicted to cause a frameshift leading to a truncated protein.

variants.segregation_data: The mutation co-segregated with breast cancer in the family.
variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence based on segregation and clinical presentation.
variants.additional_notes: The BRCA2 mutation was identified in a family previously classified as BRCA1/2 negative.
key_quotes: In family 6, exome sequencing identified a deleterious BRCA2 mutation (c.26delC, p.Pro9Glnfs*16) in a female diagnosed with breast cancer at age 30, but not in her cousin who was diagnosed at age 36.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant BRCA2 variants were extracted successfully.
